FuncDef: The reset nat session table command deletes information about NAT session entries.
CLIs: reset nat session table [ pcp ] [ source { inside <inside-address> | global <global-address> | ipv6 <ipv6-address> } | destination { inside <inside-address> | global <global-address> | ipv6 <ipv6-address> } | slot <slot-id> [ engine <cpu-id> | card <card-id> ] | source-vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> | destination-vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> | protocol { <protocol-number> | tcp | udp | icmp | esp | gre | sctp | udplite } | destination-port <port-number> | source-port-global <source-port-global-number> | user-id <user-id> | cpe <cpe-address> [ prefix-length <prefix-length> ] | { nat-instance <instance-name> | dslite-instance <dslite-instance-name> | nat64-instance <nat64-instance-name> } | long-link ] *

ParaDef.Info:
Deletes information about PCP session entries.
-

Source IP address.
-

Deletes NAT session entry information with a specified private IP address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Deletes NAT session entry information with a specified public IP address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Destination IP address.
-

Specifies the slot ID of a service board.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 16.

Deletes NAT session entry information with a specified source VPN instance name.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name must not be _public_. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Deletes NAT session entry information with a specified destination VPN instance name.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name must not be _public_. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Deletes NAT session entry information with a specified destination port number.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535.

Deletes NAT session entry information with a specified public source port number.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535.

Deletes NAT session entry information with a specified user ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295.

Deletes NAT session entry information with a specified NAT instance name.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Deletes NAT session entry information on a specified protocol type.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 255.

Transmission Control Protocol.
-

User Datagram Protocol.
-

Internet Control Message Protocol.
-

Encapsulating Security Payload.
-

Generic Routing Encapsulation.
-

Stream Control Transmission Protocol.
-

Lightweight User Datagram Protocol.
-

Deletes NAT session entry information with the TCP long-link type. This parameter can only be configured for NAT instances.
-

Deletes NAT session entry information with a specified public IPv6 address.
The value is a 32-bit hexadecimal number in the format of X:X::X:X.

Deletes session entry information with a specified IPv6 address.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Deletes session entry information with a specified IPv6 prefix.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 255.

Deletes NAT64 session entry information with a specified NAT64 instance name.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Specifies the CPU ID of a service board.This parameter takes effect only on a VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 3.

Specifies the CPU ID of a subcard on a service board.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 1.

Deletes DS-Lite session entry information with a specified DS-Lite instance name. This parameter is supported only by the VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Examples: <HUAWEI> reset nat session table slot 1 engine 0
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To delete unnecessary NAT session entries, run the reset nat session table command. This allows new NAT session entries to be created for fault location and rectification.
Configuration Impact
After the reset nat session table command is run, NAT session entries are deleted from the NAT session table based on the IP address, port number, or protocol types.
Precautions
Check whether you need to delete NAT session entry statistics before running the reset nat session table command. After the command is run, the deleted records cannot be restored. Therefore, exercise caution when using this command. The system does not display any message after NAT session entries are deleted.
Run the display nat session table command to view NAT session entry information only after the NAT sessions entries have been deleted. The deletion process takes seconds or more than 1 minute, based on the number of NAT session entries.
If you repeatedly run the reset nat session table command and a previous command instance is in process, a device ignores the existing running command instance and displays a message.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
cpe and prefix-length parameters can be configured only in NAT64.
